questions.question: Who was the first African American player in Major League Baseball?
questions.answer: Jackie Robinson, who broke the color barrier in 1947 with the Brooklyn Dodgers.

questions.question: Which athlete is credited with popularizing the slam dunk in basketball?
questions.answer: Julius Erving, also known as "Dr. J," is widely credited with popularizing the slam dunk in the 1970s with his acrobatic and powerful dunks.

questions.question: In what year did the first modern Olympic Games take place?
questions.answer: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896.

questions.question: Which female athlete has won the most Olympic gold medals?
questions.answer: Larisa Latynina, a Soviet gymnast, holds the record with 18 Olympic medals, including 9 gold medals.

questions.question: Who is considered the greatest boxer of all time?
questions.answer: This is a subject of debate, but Muhammad Ali is often considered the greatest boxer of all time due to his accomplishments, cultural impact, and personality.

questions.question: Which team won the first Super Bowl?
questions.answer: The Green Bay Packers won the first Super Bowl in 1967.

questions.question: Who hit the "Shot Heard 'Round the World" in baseball?
questions.answer: Bobby Thomson hit the game-winning home run for the New York Giants in the 1951 National League tie-breaker game against the Brooklyn Dodgers.

questions.question: Which country dominated gymnastics in the 1950s and 1960s?
questions.answer: The Soviet Union dominated gymnastics during this period, with athletes like Larisa Latynina and Olga Korbut achieving great success.

questions.question: Who was known as "The Great One" in hockey?
questions.answer: Wayne Gretzky is widely regarded as the greatest hockey player of all time and earned the nickname "The Great One."

questions.question: Which horse won the Triple Crown in 1973?
questions.answer: Secretariat won the Triple Crown in 1973, setting records in all three races that still stand today.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to run the Boston Marathon officially?
questions.answer: Kathrine Switzer officially ran the Boston Marathon in 1967, despite attempts by race officials to stop her.

questions.question: Which tennis player won a record 24 Grand Slam singles titles?
questions.answer: Margaret Court holds the record with 24 Grand Slam singles titles.

questions.question: Who is the only player to win five Super Bowl MVP awards?
questions.answer: Tom Brady has won five Super Bowl MVP awards.

questions.question: Which team won the "Miracle on Ice" at the 1980 Winter Olympics?
questions.answer: The United States men's hockey team defeated the heavily favored Soviet Union team in the semi-final game at the 1980 Winter Olympics.

questions.question: Who was the first African American to win the Wimbledon Championships?
questions.answer: Althea Gibson won the Wimbledon Championships in 1957 and 1958.

questions.question: Which golfer is known as "The Golden Bear"?
questions.answer: Jack Nicklaus, one of the greatest golfers of all time, is known as "The Golden Bear."

questions.question: Who was the first woman to swim the English Channel?
questions.answer: Gertrude Ederle was the first woman to swim the English Channel in 1926.

questions.question: Which cyclist won the Tour de France a record seven consecutive times?
questions.answer: Lance Armstrong won the Tour de France seven consecutive times from 1999 to 2005, but his titles were later stripped due to doping violations.

questions.question: Who was known as "The Babe" in baseball?
questions.answer: Babe Ruth, one of the most iconic figures in baseball history, was known as "The Babe" or "The Sultan of Swat."

questions.question: Which athlete lit the Olympic cauldron at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta?
questions.answer: Muhammad Ali lit the Olympic cauldron at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta.

questions.question: Who was the first gymnast to score a perfect 10 at the Olympics?
questions.answer: Nadia Comăneci, a Romanian gymnast, was the first gymnast to score a perfect 10 at the 1976 Montreal Olympics.

questions.question: Which basketball player is known as "His Airness"?
questions.answer: Michael Jordan, widely considered one of the greatest basketball players of all time, is known as "His Airness."

questions.question: Who was the first African American driver to win the Indianapolis 500?
questions.answer: Willy T. Ribbs was the first African American driver to qualify for the Indianapolis 500 in 1991.

questions.question: Which soccer player is known as "Pelé"?
questions.answer: Edson Arantes do Nascimento, widely regarded as the greatest soccer player of all time, is known as "Pelé."

questions.question: Which female athlete is known as "The Greatest Woman Athlete of All Time"?
questions.answer: Babe Didrikson Zaharias, an American athlete who excelled in multiple sports, is often called "The Greatest Woman Athlete of All Time."

questions.question: Who broke Babe Ruth's single-season home run record in 1961?
questions.answer: Roger Maris broke Babe Ruth's single-season home run record in 1961 with 61 home runs.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to win an Olympic marathon?
questions.answer: Joan Benoit Samuelson won the first Olympic women's marathon at the 1984 Los Angeles Olympics.

questions.question: Which athlete is known as "The Flying Finn"?
questions.answer: Paavo Nurmi, a Finnish long-distance runner, was known as "The Flying Finn" for his dominance in the 1920s.

questions.question: Who was the first Black NBA player?
questions.answer: Earl Lloyd was the first Black NBA player, making his debut with the Washington Capitols in 1950.

questions.question: Which female tennis player won the "Grand Slam" in 1953?
questions.answer: Maureen Connolly won the Grand Slam in 1953, winning all four major championships in a single calendar year.

questions.question: Who was the youngest player to win a major golf championship?
questions.answer: Young Tom Morris won the 1868 Open Championship at the age of 17.

questions.question: Which athlete won seven gold medals at the 1972 Munich Olympics?
questions.answer: Mark Spitz, an American swimmer, won seven gold medals at the 1972 Munich Olympics.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame?
questions.answer: Effa Manley, the owner of the Newark Eagles in the Negro leagues, was the first woman to be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2006.

questions.question: Which athlete is known as "The Manassa Mauler"?
questions.answer: Jack Dempsey, a heavyweight boxing champion in the 1920s, was known as "The Manassa Mauler."

questions.question: Who was the first African American to win an Olympic gold medal?
questions.answer: John Taylor, a member of the U.S. 4x400 meter relay team, won the first Olympic gold medal for an African American at the 1908 London Olympics.
